section.name: AstroGrid Workbench
section.p:
The Workbench is a desktop GUI application that interacts with AstroGrid services. It provides
Utility applications that
Browse, read and write MySpace
Launch Parameterized Workflows
Launch remote (CEA) applications
Monitor and control workflows and applications
View registry entries
a simple programmer's interface for working with AstroGrid services. This interface can be accessed from scripts and other programs via HTTP or XML/RPC.

subsection.name: Launch the Workbench
subsection.p: We provide two versions of the Workbench: a stable version, published once per release; and a beta version, which is published more often, may provide more features, but which is less well tested.

The workbench is written in the Java programming language. Provided you already have Java installed on your machine, click one of the links below to launch the workbench using Java WebStart

section.name: Workbench Features
section.p: The following sections illustrate some of the features of the Workbench.

subsection.name: MySpace Browser
subsection.p: The MySpace browser lets you see the contents of your MySpace store, copy, move & delete files, and upload or download data to your MySpace.

subsection.name: CEA Application Launcher
subsection.p: The Appliction launcher lets you browse a list of published remote applications and data sources, and then simply execute one by providing a few parameters.

subsection.name: Job Monitor
subsection.p: Enables you monitor the progress of running workflows and remote applications. New workflows can be submitted for execution, and the results of completed ones viewed and then deleted.
